New Records: Shaan Masood scored 44, the highest score by a Zimbabwean batsman in a T20 World Cup match against Pakistan
Key Match Events: Pakistan's chase got off to a rocky start, squeezed at 36 for three in the eighth over
Shaan Masood steadied the ship with a composed 44 before being stumped off a Raza wide
Late runs from Brad Evans (19 off 15 balls) gave Zimbabwe the lift they ultimately needed
Sean Williams was bowled by Shadab Khan for 31, triggering a collapse of four for none in six deliveries
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan find their tournament in tatters, having restricted Zimbabwe to a modest 130 for eight at Perth Stadium
Mohammed Nawaz’s nightmare tournament continued when he was caught for 22 from the penultimate ball of the match off Brad Evans
Post-Match Reflections: Raza said, “I really, truly believe in this group of boys. Since I’ve been part of Zimbabwe cricket, I would rate that as the best victory we’ve had. There’s no better stage. This is the World Cup, the biggest stage of all.”
The Pakistan captain Babar Azam said, “Today we were not up to the mark in all three departments.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The partnership between Rilee Rossouw and Quinton de Kock was the highest in the tournament’s history, eclipsing the 166-run union between Sri Lanka’s Kumar Sangakkara and Mahela Jayawardene in 2010
Half-centuries from Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav helped India make it two wins from two with an impressive 56-run victory over the Netherlands in Sydney
Others: The all-rounder Sikandar Raza picked up three for 25 against Pakistan on Thursday as Zimbabwe won by one run to register their first Super 12 victory at the T20 World Cup
Mohammad Wasim took four for 24 for Pakistan in the match
